member.name: T:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.ConfigurationManager
member.summary: Provides methods for sending device configuration files to Configuration Manager for either complete processing, or just for testing.

item.description: Windows Mobile Version 2003 (not Classic Edition) and later

member.name: M:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.ConfigurationManager.ProcessConfiguration(System.Xml.XmlDocument,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends a device configuration file to Configuration Manager for processing.
member.param: The configuration document used to provision the device.
true to return metadata associated with the XML parm elements in the new configuration; otherwise, false.
member.returns: If metadata is true, this method returns metadata associated with the XML parm elements in this configuration.

member.name: M:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.ConfigurationManager.TestConfiguration(System.Xml.XmlDocument,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends a device configuration file to Configuration Manager for testing.
member.param: The configuration document used to provision the device.
true to return metadata associated with the XML parm elements in the new configuration; otherwise, false.
member.returns: If metadata is true, this method returns metadata associated with the XML parm elements in this configuration.
member.remarks: Configuration Manager will not process the configuration file, but it can still return useful metadata associated with the XML parm elements.

member.name: M:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.ConfigurationManager.QueryPolicy(InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy)
member.summary: Retrieves the value of the policy specified.
member.returns: The value of the policy identified by policy.
member.remarks:
If the policy setting does not exist, zero (0) is returned. Platforms Supported
Windows MobileWindows Mobile Version 5.0 and later

member.name: P:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.ConfigurationManager.CurrentTrust
member.summary: Retrieves the assigned trust level of a process.

item.description: Pocket PC 2003 and later, Windows Mobile Version 5.0 and later
Windows CE 4.1 to Windows Embedded CE 6.0

member.name: T:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.TrustLevel
member.summary: Indicates the level of trust for a process.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.TrustLevel.NoTrust
member.summary: The OEM does not trust this module.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.TrustLevel.Restricted
member.summary: The OEM trusts the module to run, but restricts the module from making certain function calls.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.TrustLevel.Trusted
member.summary: The OEM trusts the module to perform any OS function calls.

member.name: T:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy
member.summary: Contains standard security policy identifiers.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.AutoRun
member.summary: Indicates whether applications stored on a storage card are allowed to auto-run when inserted into the device.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.Rapi
member.summary: Restricts the access of remote applications that are using Remote API (RAPI) to implement ActiveSync operations on Windows Mobile powered devices.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.UnsignedCabs
member.summary: Indicates whether unsigned .cab files can be installed on the device.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.UnsignedApplications
member.summary: Indicates whether unsigned applications are allowed to run on Windows Mobile powered devices.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.UnsignedThemes
member.summary: Indicates whether theme files can be installed on the device.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.TpsCarrierRole
member.summary: Indicates whether mobile operators can be assigned the Trusted Provisioning Server (TPS) role.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.MaxAuthenticationRetry
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of times the user is allowed to try authenticating a Wireless Application Protocol (WAP) PIN-signed message.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.WapSignedMessage
member.summary:
Indicates whether a WAP signed message is accepted based on whether the role assigned to the message matches any of the roles specified in the policy setting. All messages are assigned role masks based on its security level and origin. The result of AND combination of the message role mask with the policy role mask determines how the message is processed. If the result is non-zero, the message is accepted.
Deprecated - Use OmaCPNetworkPINMessage and OmaCPUserPINMessage policies

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.SLMessage
member.summary: Indicates whether SL messages are accepted. An SL message downloads new services or provisioning XML to the Windows Mobile powered device.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.SIMessage
member.summary: Indicates whether SI messages are accepted. An SI message is sent to Windows Mobile 6 Standard to notify users of new services, service updates, and provisioning services.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.UnauthenticatedMessages
member.summary: Indicates whether to accept unsigned WAP messages processed by the default security provider in the Security Module (Push Router), based on their origin.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.OtaProvisioning
member.summary: Specifies which provisioning messages are accepted by the configuration host based on the roles assigned to the messages.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.WspPush
member.summary: Indicates whether Wireless Session Protocol (WSP) notifications from the WAP stack are routed.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.GrantManager
member.summary: Grants the system administrative privileges held by SECROLE_MANAGER to other security roles, without modifying metabase role assignments.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.GrantUserAuthenticated
member.summary: Grants privileges held by SECROLE_USER_AUTH to other security roles without modifying metabase role assignments.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.TrustedWapProxy
member.summary: This setting specifies the level of permissions required to create, modify, or delete a trusted proxy. WAP proxies are configured by means of the PXLOGICAL characteristic element in a WAP provisioning XML document. A WAP proxy is trusted when the TRUST parameter is specified in the PXLOGICAL characteristic element.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.UnsignedPrompt
member.summary: This setting indicates whether a user is prompted to accept or reject unsigned .cab, theme, .dll and .exe files.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.PrivilegedApplications
member.summary: Specifies which security model is implemented on the device.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.SLSecureDownload
member.summary: Allows the operator to override https to use http or wsps to use wsp.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.SoftwareCertificates
member.summary: Determines whether software certificates can be used to sign outgoing messages. You can use this security policy with a tool that you create to allow people to import certificates.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.DrmWapRights
member.summary: Specifies which DRM rights messages are accepted by the DRM engine based on the role assigned to the message.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.LassPasswordRequired
member.summary: Indicates whether a password must be configured on the device.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.WapNetworkPinPrompt
member.summary: Used when the over the air (OTA) OMA Client Provisioning message is signed with only a network personal identification number (PIN). Indicates whether or not to prompt the user to accept device setting changes.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.MobileEncryptRemovable
member.summary: Specifies if the user is allowed to change mobile encryption settings for the removable storage media.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.Bluetooth
member.summary: Specifies if a Bluetooth enabled device allows other devices to perform a search on the device.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.HtmlMessage
member.summary: Specifies whether message transports will allow HTML messages.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.SMimeSigning
member.summary: Specifies whether the Inbox application will send all messaged signed.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.SMimeEncryption
member.summary: Specifies whether the Inbox application will send all messages encrypted.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.SMimeSigningAlgorithm
member.summary: Specifies which algorithm to use to sign a message.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.SMimeEncryptionAlgorithm
member.summary: Specifies which algorithm to use to encrypt a message.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.OmaCPNetworkPinMessage
member.summary: Determines whether the OMA network PIN signed message will be accepted. The message's role mask and the policy's role mask are combined using the AND operator. If the result is non-zero, then the message is accepted.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.OmaCPUserPinMessage
member.summary: Determines whether the OMA user PIN or user MAC signed message will be accepted. The message's role mask and the policy's role mask are combined using the AND operator. If the result is non-zero, then the message is accepted.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.OmaCPUserNetworkPinMessage
member.summary: Determines whether the OMA user network PIN signed message will be accepted. The message's role mask and the policy's role mask are combined using the AND operator. If the result is non-zero, then the message is accepted.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.SMimeEncryptionNegotiation
member.summary: Specifies whether the Inbox application can negotiate the encryption algorithm in case a recipient's certificate does not support the specified encryption algorithm.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.SharepointUncProtocolAccess
member.summary: Enables or disables Outlook Mobile SharePoint or UNC access through ActiveSync protocol to get documents.

member.name: F:InTheHand.WindowsMobile.Configuration.SecurityPolicy.LassDesktopQuickConnect
member.summary: Specifies how device authentication is handled when connecting to the desktop.
